did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The Janet Hamill Archive contains extensive materials that document the life and work of Janet Hamill and illuminates Hamill's unique relationship with her longtime friend Patti Smith.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The Janet Hamill Archive contains extensive materials that document the life and work of Janet Hamill. The archive additionally illuminates Hamill's unique relationship with her longtime friend, poet, writer, singer-songwriter and artist Patti Smith. Included are correspondence (approximately 380 letters), manuscripts, journals, notebooks, diaries (several thousand pages dated 1967-2007) and photographs documenting Hamill's work. Also included are materials pertaining to Patti Smith consisting of correspondence (approximately 100 letters), manuscripts and notes concerning the book Just Kids (approximately 1,000 pages) and photographs of and by Patti Smith.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:

scopecontent.p: Includes 1 donation envelope; 1 information pamphlet; 1 free gift flyer; 1 addressed and stamped return envelope.

American composer, musician, conductor, and writer. Amram has composed more than 100 orchestral and chamber music works, and written many scores for Broadway theater and film, including Robert Frank and Alfred Leslieâs Pull My Daisy.
Anderson is the manager of the Strand Rare Book Room. He is the stepson of American playwright Maxwell Anderson
American author. Auster has published poems, essays, novels of his own as well as translations of French writers.
Baron is a photographer and collaborated on a book with Janet Hamill.

Musician and performer, best known for being a member of the seminal New York No Wave band The Contortions and part of the early all-girl band The Bloods. Had roles in many New York Underground films and is also known for her work as a backup singer. She and Janet are longtime friends and performed together in the past
Poet and performer, he and Janet had numerous readings together
Former Janet English professor and chair of English Department at Rowan University.
Cherry was the editor at Norton for the never realized Eternal CafÃ©, a collaboration between Janet and Paula Smith
Writer, editor, poet.
Cathy Cress attended Glassboro State College with Janet and was the editor of the college newspaper. She has an MSW in aging and is an expert on geriatric care.
DeRugeris attended Glassboro State College with Janet. He is a poet and author of speculative fiction
Includes photocopy of article by Janet's father
Hanuman Books publisher.
Janet's sister-in-law.
Janet's sister.
Janet's sister.

scopecontent.p: Barbara Kruger is a well-known conceptual artist and was friends with JH throughout the 70âs. They were introduced to each other by Ken Tisa.
Including cards.
Gloryia Okulski was an inspirational English teacher during JHâs junior year of high school. Janet considers her responsible for her being a poet

scopecontent.p: American poet, publisher and editor. Owen was co-director of the St. Markâs Poetry Project in New York City. She is the editor and publisher of Telephone Books and has published two of JHâs books.
Includes "The New Romantics--A Manifesto."
An artist and early friend of Janet and Patti Smith. He has also collaborated with poets Max Blagg and Kenward Elmslie.
Played bass in Janet's band.

scopecontent.p: 2 copies of the broadside. 1 copy has the name âJuanâ crossed out and replaced by âJanet.â Also included is the layout, with original artwork, for the broadside.

6 issues. Glassboro State College literary magazine. Both Patti (Patricia) Smith and Janet Hamill were on the Avant staff. It served as an early area over which the two bonded. Work by JH, but not PS, appears in several of these issues.
Assorted poetry manuscripts, "Delouz Entago", drafts, "A Poem for All Seasons", handwritten lists.

Folder with assorted items, including: proofs for âThe Birds of the Airâ included in the Gary Indiana anthology Living with the Animals, also included is some correspondence with Indiana and the bookâs editor; tear sheet from Kansas Quarterly; and items related to Janet's contribution to More Reflections on the Meaning of Life.

did.unittitle: Subseries IIf: Other Material on Janet Hamill

scopecontent.p: Assorted newspapers, writings and a student paper on JH.

did.unittitle: Series III: Announcements for Performances/Readings and Related Material

scopecontent.p: Assorted materials, including correspondence, books, brochures, receipts, and travel material related to Janet's trip to the UK to present a reading and workshop, also included is some correspondence related to Janet's UK trip to participate in the Latitude Festival.
3 rubber stamps used for flyers and announcement cards, including readings at The Poetry Project 1978? and a reading with Max Blagg at the Ear Inn.
8 Â½ x 14 inch poster for JH reading with Max Blagg at St. Marks Church. The poster has poems by both Blagg and JH. Also included is the layout, with original artwork by Kenneth Tisa.
8 Â½ by 14 inch poster for reading by Juan Hamill (JHâs nom de plume) at 41 Worth Street. The poster has a poem by JH. Also included is the layout, with original artwork by Kenneth Tisa.

did.unittitle: Ear Inn reading with Ravi Singh

scopecontent.p: Postcard, source material and layout for the postcard.

did.unittitle: Short Pieces: Electric Music, Performance, Film

scopecontent.p: JH performed as âJanet H.â at 33 Grand Street. Other performers, included Laurie Anderson, Adele Bertei, Rhys Chatham, Glenn Branca, John Lurie, Jeffrey Lohn, and others.

2 9 x 14 inch posters for reading that also included Maxwell Blagg, David Matlin, and others. On the verso of one of the posters is a manuscript, with corrections, of JH poem âThe Two Yellow Pills.â
Small flyer for a reading that included Juan Hamill (JHâs nom de plume) at A.I.R. Gallery. Also included is the layout with original artwork for the flyer.
Flyer and original artwork for JH reading with Adele Bertei and Max Blagg at the Mud[d Club].
Flyer for the festival in which JH participated. There is also correspondence concerning a possible JH reading at the Strand Bookstore.
2 flyers for JH and Moving Starâs performance as part of Whitman Sunday at the Walt Whitman Cultural Arts Center, Camden N.J. There is also some correspondence concerning the event.

Schedule and poster for the event, Mar 30âApr 1, 2001. Patti Smith and her Band played with JH and Moving Star. The Gathering featured Stanley Kunitz, John Ashbery, Brenda Hillman, Galway Kinnell, and many others.

JH participated in this Rededication of The Cathedral Church of Saint John the Devine. Folder includes invitation to the event, correspondence, stage pass, t-shirt, and other items. Other participants included, among many, Mike Albo, Samantha Jones, and Jayne Cortez.

did.unittitle: Word: The Jay Liveson Memorial Poetry and Music Festival

scopecontent.p: JH participated in this festival presented by Exoterica and The College of Mount Saint Vincent (Bronx, N.Y). Folder includes flyer and card for the event, correspondence and program. Other participants included, among many, Billy Collins, Jim Carroll, Richard Hell, Edwin Torres, and Big Youth.

did.unittitle: A Poet Paints: A One Woman Show

scopecontent.p: Flyer, publicity photo, statement, checklist (with prices), and press coverage of JH solo exhibition of her paintings.

Approximately 30 assorted items for JH readings and performances, including: participation in Stan Vanderbeekâs New Wilderness event âDream Festâ , Sep 17, 1979; reading with Ed Friedman at the Zu; âAll Hallowâs Eveâ reading with Annabel Levitt at St. Markâs Church; reading with Maureen Owen at the Ear Inn; reading with Jack Collom at St. Markâs Church; reading (as Juan Hamill) with Barbara Kruger at Artists Space; and programs from The Poetry Projectâs Annual New Yearâs Day Marathon Reading.

Approximately 50 assorted items, primarily flyers and âset listsâ for JH readings and performances, including: participation in âGreatest Hits 60 Poets: 60 Poems All-Star Benefitâ for NYC Poetry Calendar at Environ ; original artwork for flyer for âLadies Choiceâ reading with Ann Powell and Ruth Kligman at 11 West 20; items related to participation in âPraise Day for Philip Lamatia! âBecoming Visibleââ; readings 17 at the 9th Precinct Gallery, ABC NO RIO and the Figaro Cafe; and flyer and program for âJet of Bloodâ directed by Bob Holman at Ward Nasse Gallery.
8 items, including posters announcing: The Poetry Project Valentineâs Day Reading, 1988 ; Rose Drachler Memorial Reading, 1983, and âPoems at the 9th Precinct Galleryâ.

15 items, including posters announcing: The Poets Theatre and The Poetry Projectâs Annual New Yearâs Day Marathon Reading. Programs include the program for âPatti Smithâs Meltdown,â London, 2005 at which JH also performed. Also: posters for âThe Blank Generation and Beyond,â grand opening of the Pioneer Theater, New York.

did.unittitle: Subseries Xa: Correspondence with Janet Hamill

scopecontent.p: Written on cover: âFeaturing old correspondence Note: new correspondence can be designated by blue fountain pen,â return address at the Hotel Chelsea, and âPatricia L Smith.â There are also several stickers on the cover. Inside are handwritten poems, thoughts, songs, and lists written to JH. Items laid in at different pages include: two poems, âexclusive pix of Howie [Howard Michaels],â ad for Jesse Winchester album, and clipping of James Dean on newsprint.
Includes photographs, poems, and a lock of Janet's brother's hair.

Photographs, some for Body of Water

scopecontent.p: A 4 7/8 x 7 Â½ inch wood (cigar?) box that PS created after visiting Federico GarcÃ­a Lorcaâs niece and handling an âoriginalâ copy of Poeta en Nueva York. PS presented the box to JH. It contains items that she brought back from Spain and includes: linen gloves that PS wore while handling the GarcÃ­a Lorca manuscript, an unburned votive candle; a dried flower; a picture of GarcÃ­a Lorca; a paper lace doily; a British pound coin; a Spanish postcard from 1903 of an unidentified woman; and a slip of paper with âOctubre 2007â printed on it.

did.unittitle: Subseries Xd: Just Kids Manuscripts and Notes

scopecontent.p: Inserted in back of pad is handwritten manuscript on notebook graph paper of the poem âWild Leavesâ that appears only in the paperback edition of Just Kids. Also inserted in back are a color photocopy of six SX-70 photographs of Jesse Smith (?) in a graveyard with Smith family gravestones and a photocopy from parts of a Los Angeles Times article about Robert Mapplethorpeâs artwork.
Including chronologies, journal entries, letters (never sent), dreams and poems.

Notes, questions, suggestions for sections and areas needing to be developed, including tone and focus of the book. Also noted are new sections, additional writing and other changes that have been done to the manuscript.

did.unittitle: Hotel Chelsea folder with typed manuscript pages
"Separate Ways Together" with notes and writings
"East Side Sutra: View from a Window", The Press

scopecontent.p: A complete issue of The Press, a monthly New York City newspaper. It contains a section âThe East Village: The Pangs of Rebirth,â with this Patti Smith contributed article.
With an issue of Vanity Fair

did.unittitle: "Return of Patti Smith", The Village Voice

scopecontent.p: Smith's reed from when she played with JH and Moving Star

Announcement card for Patti Smith solo exhibition at the Robert Miller Gallery. The exhibition included recent photographs as well as an installation piece, a composite of objects, drawings, and a vintage silk cloth inscribed by the arti

did.unittitle: Just Kids excerpt in Rolling Stone
Forward to Nostalgia of the Infinite
Postcard of Jean-Paul Belmondo sent to Janet Hamill
Photograph of Hamill and Smith taken at the Village Gate
Framed self-portrait of Smith and Hamill

scopecontent.p: Drawing with colored pencil of PS with JH, 1966. This was made while JH was living with PSâs family. It is inscribed by PS: âChaps, ltd. 1966. With love to Chaps.â According to JH, this drawing had been in the possession of Robert Mapplethorpe for over twenty years. It was given back to PS, by his estate, after his death. PS later gave the drawing to JH. 10 x 13 drawing in 19 x 23 inch frame.

did.unittitle: Memorial card with Patti Smith poem
List of speakers at Mapplethorpe memorial
Invitation to a ceremony commemorating the anniversary of Mapplethorpe's cancelled exhibit
Subseries Xg: Performances and Events with Patti Smith and Janet Hamill

scopecontent.p: Handbill, for a reading with Anne Powell, Juan Hamill (Janet Hamill) and Patti Smith at the Razor Gallery. Also included is the original collage artwork for the handbill.

JH read her poems as the opening act for Patti Smithâs Central Park Summerstage appearance. Included are: an artistâs agreement, posters, t-shirt, Neil Straussâs New York Times review, clippings, and poems with handwritten notes that JH read.

JH and Patti Smith were brought to Boston by their old friend Patti Hudson. This was Smithâs first Boston appearance in 16 years. They did an evening of readings together and had an exhibition. Smith showed Polaroids at the Art Market Gallery, and JH showed her watercolors. Included are: publicity around the events, some correspondence and a t-shirt made for the event.

did.unittitle: Liss Ard Festival, Co. Cork, Ireland

scopecontent.p: Patti Smith was the festivalâs first director in 1997. JH participated in the festival and did several readings, including a reading with Patti Smith and Nick Cave. Includes: photographs of the event (approx 70 color snapshots and 11 8 x 10 inch black and white photographs); itinerary; correspondence; tshirts; âThe Gardens Voice: Liss Ard 97â, and press folder.
JH and Moving Star opened for Patti Smith and her Band. Includes: participant badge; letter of agreement; some correspondence; and programs for the event.

did.unittitle: Strange Messenger, opening party and reading

scopecontent.p: Flyer for JH and Moving Star performance at the Warhol Museum. At the time âStrange Messenger: The Art of Patti Smithâ was on also display at the Museum. Also included in the folder is JH agreement with the Museum, correspondence and other items.

The 2005 Meltdown was directed by Patti Smith. She performed along with many others, including JH, Antony and the Johnsons, Beth Orton, Billy Bragg, Cat Power, Joanna Newsom, John Cale, Lenny Kaye, Martha Wainwright, Marc Almond, Richard Hell, Roy Harper, SinÃ©ad O'Connor, Television, and Yoko Ono. JH performed with John Giorno and also discussed her work with Smith. Included are: the eventâs program, stage pass, correspondence, letter of agreement, publicity, and 2 handwritten manuscripts in JHâs hand.
JH and Moving Star were the opening act for Patti Smithâs 2005 Central Park Summerstage appearance. Included are: stage pass, correspondence, set list and 34 snapshots of the event.
Both Patti Smith and JH performed at the first annual Latitude Festival. Included are a UK newspaper with an article about the festival and 2 performer wristbands.

did.unittitle: An Intimate Evening with Patti Smith and Janet Hamill

scopecontent.p: Both Smith and JH attended Rowan when it was named Glassboro State College. Included are: program, set list, press release, and photocopies of snapshots.
